msgSnippet: I am far from an Junit expert and I don t know whether this will help, but I have seen exactly this same error when accessing a class that has moved around

Subject: RE: [junit] Problem loading apache.xerces classes

From: Steve Gardell <sgardell@...>

I am far from an Junit expert and I don't know 
whether this will help, but I have seen exactly
this same error when accessing a class that has
moved around with the old .class file still hanging
around in the directory tree. Suggests that the 
problem was finding the wrong "version" of a class.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: David V. Olivier [mailto:dolivier@...]
> Sent: Thursday, October 11, 2001 11:13 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Problem loading apache.xerces classes
> 
> 
> I have been using JUnit for some time but am new to this 
> mailing list.  In 
> the past I have not had any problems with JUnit loading the necessary 
> classes.  However, I am currently developing an object which 
> uses Apache's 
> Xerxes module for parsing XML documents.  When I attempt to 
> execute the 
> test I get a linkage error during setup:
> 
> java.lang.LinkageError: loader constraints violated when linking 
> org/w3c/dom/Document class
> at 
> org.apache.xerces.jaxp.DocumentBuilderFactoryImpl.newDocumentB
> uilder(DocumentBuilder 
> FactoryImpl.java:87)
> at MetcastDatabaseInterfacePkg.Catalog.<init>(Catalog.java:30)
> at 
> MetcastDatabaseInterfacePkg.tests.CatalogTest.setUp(CatalogTes
> t.java:27)
> 
> I don't fully understand JUnit's class loader mechanism.  Any 
> suggestions 
> on how to resolve this problem?
> 
> Thanks,
> 
> David Olivier
>
